oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-11-09 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 9, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Porter Wagoner (host/performer), guest performer Mac Wiseman, and regular performers the Old Hickory Singers, Chet Atkins (who is ""just back from a big week in New York""), Rod Brasfield, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 944th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Rod Brasfield; Mac Wiseman; Del Wood; Porter Wagoner
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Porter Wagoner introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Porter Wagoner) -- Prince Albert commercial (Rod Brasfield, Porter Wagoner) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Porter Wagoner introduces Mac Wiseman -- I'll Still Write Your Name In The Sand (Mac Wiseman) -- Porter Wagoner introduces Del Wood -- Maggie Blues (Del Wood) -- Porter Wagoner talks -- Your Love (Porter Wagoner) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Porter Wagoner) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Station announcements -- Station announcements (Grant Turner) -- Noel Hotel commercial (Grant Turner) (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Old Hickory Singers; Wagoner, Porter; Wiseman, Mac
